Hi,

I consider myself more of a mockist TDD practitioner than a classicist these days - I would strongly advocate mocking to 
keep your tests fast and simple. Why test a third party application such as Hibernate? That's not your job, surely?

If you want to test your classes which use Hibernate, mock the actual Hibernate classes within your code and write some 
behaviour driven tests, e.g. "my fetch method calls Hibernate with this HQL". That way you ensure you're using Hibernate 
in the right way.

I'd also advocate writing tests against your Hibernate config... test _how_ you use a third party application like 
Spring or Hibernate, but not the third party application itself.

S
